Posts.Content: Feb 7, 2014 08:04PM Christycain17 wrote: Teaspoon, I understand what you feel.  I am going through some of the same. Two clusters of microcifications. Having my first biopsies next Tues. I too chose to keep my family from it all to save them the worry...and I just felt like crying when you said you felt like a baby. I said the same thing and I felt so alone in this struggle. But like you I found this sight and all of these AMAZING WOMEN have shown such love and strenghth that for the first time I realize I'm... (we're).... not.  Please keep us posted. I will certainly keep you in my prayers.

Posts.Content: Feb 11, 2014 03:51PM Christycain17 wrote: Well had the biopsies this am. Wasn't as bad as I had feared. Felt/feel a bit drunk lol. But relieved it is over!  Dr Thompson said he should know by Friday. The first biop was a tad sore but nothing I couldn't get through and defenantly not as horrible as I had imagined. And I'm certain it was due to all you ladies prayers!! Thank you so much!! I'm continuing to send prayers you ways!! (((HUGS TO ALL OF YOU))) Will keep you posted. Now I think I'll take a little nap. Love you all!
